alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Powder River; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Big Horn, northwestern Powder River and southern Rosebud Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 712 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lodge Grass to 23 miles southeast of Ashland. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lodge Grass, Lame Deer, Crow Agency, Ashland, Busby, Birney, Kirby, Muddy Cluster, Rosebud Battlefield Park, Birney Village and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for south central and southeastern Montana.

area.areaDesc: Northern Big Horn; Powder River; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud
